description: Uakaris are short-tailed New World monkeys with distinctive faces, native to Amazonian forests.
They feed on fruit and seeds and are arboreal.
Sea urchins are spiny echinoderms that graze on algae on rocky reefs and play key ecological roles.
They have a round, spiny test and move using tube feet.
Umbrellabirds are tropical forest birds with a crest or umbrella-like plumage on their heads used in display.
They feed on fruit and small animals in the canopy.
The urial is a wild sheep of central and south Asia inhabiting mountainous and arid regions.
They graze on grasses and shrubs and form herds.
Uromastyx are herbivorous agamid lizards native to arid regions, known for spiny tails and burrowing behaviour.
They feed primarily on plant material and are adapted to hot, dry habitats.
